Detailed Description

Listens request and accept connection from client.

ServerSocket works in nonblocking mode. ClientSockets generated by accpet is also nonblocking. To use ServerSocket, build a class to implement IServerSocketListener, bind an address and listen. After listen(), ServerSocket starts listening and calls onAccepted() when a request is received. ServerSocket will runs until it is destroyed. 

   ServerSocket server;
   ClientSocket *socket;
   server.bind(IPEndPoint(IP4Address("127.0.0.1"), 30000);
   server.listen(0); // Server is listening.
   server.accept(&socket); // This is a asynchronous operation, when it is
                           // done, onAccepted() will be called.

void gaia::net::ServerSocket::setServerSocketListener ( IServerSocketListener *  listener)

Set a listener to the socket.

ServerSocket isn't responsible for deleting the listener.

Parameters:
